foundation_features.name: Gifted Performer
foundation_features.description: Once per long rest per song, perform one of three songs: Relaxing Song clears 1 Hit Point for you and allies within close range; Epic Song makes a target within close range temporarily Vulnerable; Heartbreaking Song grants a Hope to you and allies within close range.

specialization_features.name: Maestro
specialization_features.description: When you give a Rally Die to an ally, they can gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

mastery_features.name: Virtuoso
mastery_features.description: You can perform each Gifted Performer song twice per long rest.

foundation_features.name: Rousing Speech
foundation_features.description: Once per long rest, give an inspiring speech. All allies within far range clear 2 Stress.

foundation_features.name: Heart of a Poet
foundation_features.description: After you make an action roll to impress, persuade, or offend someone, you can spend a Hope to add a d4 to the roll.

specialization_features.name: Eloquent
specialization_features.description: Once per session, when you encourage an ally, choose one: let them find a mundane object or tool they need; Help an Ally without spending Hope; or give them an additional downtime move during their next rest.

mastery_features.name: Epic Poetry
mastery_features.description: Your Rally Die increases to a d10. When you Help an Ally, you can narrate their heroism and roll a d10 as your advantage die.

foundation_features.name: Elemental Incarnation
foundation_features.description: Mark a Stress to Channel fire, earth, water, or air until you take severe damage or your next rest. Fire: when an adversary within melee range damages you, they take 1d10 magic damage. Earth: gain a bonus to damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency. Water: when you damage an adversary within melee range, all other adversaries within very close range mark a Stress. Air: you can hover, gaining advantage on Agility rolls.

specialization_features.name: Elemental Aura
specialization_features.description: Once per rest while Channeling, assume an aura matching your element that affects targets within close range until Channeling ends. Fire: when an adversary marks 1 or more Hit Points, they also mark a Stress. Earth: allies gain +1 Strength. Water: when an adversary damages you, you can mark a Stress to move them anywhere within very close range of where they are. Air: when you or an ally takes damage from beyond melee range, reduce the damage by 1d8.

mastery_features.name: Elemental Dominion
mastery_features.description: While Channeling, gain a benefit based on your element. Fire: +1 Proficiency to damaging attacks and spells. Earth: when you would mark Hit Points, roll a d6 per Hit Point; each 6 reduces the number marked by 1. Water: when an attack against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress to make the attacker temporarily Vulnerable. Air: gain +1 Evasion and you can fly.

foundation_features.name: Clarity of Nature
foundation_features.description: Once per long rest, create a space of natural serenity within close range. After a few minutes of rest there, clear Stress equal to your Instinct, distributed among you and allies as you choose.

foundation_features.name: Regeneration
foundation_features.description: Touch a creature and spend 3 Hope; they clear 1d4 Hit Points.

specialization_features.name: Regenerative Reach
specialization_features.description: You can target creatures within very close range with Regeneration.

specialization_features.name: Renewing Ward
specialization_features.description: Once per long rest, spend 2 Hope to clear 2 Hit Points on 1d4 allies within close range.

mastery_features.name: Defender
mastery_features.description: While in Beastform, when an ally within close range marks 2 or more Hit Points, you can mark a Stress to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by 1.

foundation_features.name: Unwavering
foundation_features.description: Gain a permanent +1 bonus to your damage thresholds.

foundation_features.name: Iron Will
foundation_features.description: When you take physical damage, you can mark an additional Armor Slot to reduce the severity.

specialization_features.name: Unrelenting
specialization_features.description: Gain a permanent +2 bonus to your damage thresholds.

specialization_features.name: Partners in Arms
specialization_features.description: When an ally within very close range takes damage, you can mark an Armor Slot to reduce the severity by one step.

mastery_features.name: Undaunted
mastery_features.description: Gain a permanent +3 bonus to your damage thresholds.

mastery_features.name: Loyal Protector
mastery_features.description: When an ally within close range has 2 or fewer Hit Points and would take damage, you can mark a Stress to sprint to their side and take the damage instead.

foundation_features.name: At Ease
foundation_features.description: Gain an additional Stress slot.

foundation_features.name: Revenge
foundation_features.description: When an adversary within melee range succeeds on an attack against you, you can mark 2 Stress to force the attacker to mark a Hit Point.

specialization_features.name: Vengeful Reprisal
specialization_features.description: When an adversary damages an ally within melee range, gain +1 Proficiency on your next successful attack against that adversary.

mastery_features.name: Nemesis
mastery_features.description: Spend 2 Hope to Prioritize an adversary until your next rest. When you attack your Prioritized adversary, you can swap the results of your Hope and Fear Dice. You can only Prioritize one adversary at a time.

foundation_features.name: Companion
foundation_features.description: You have an animal companion of your choice. They stay by your side unless you direct otherwise. Take the Ranger Companion sheet and choose a companion level-up option whenever you level up.

specialization_features.name: Expert Training
specialization_features.description: Choose an additional level-up option for your companion.

specialization_features.name: Battle-Bonded
specialization_features.description: When an adversary attacks you while they are within your companion's melee range, gain +2 Evasion against the attack.

mastery_features.name: Advanced Training
mastery_features.description: Choose two additional level-up options for your companion.

mastery_features.name: Loyal Friend
mastery_features.description: Once per long rest, when damage would mark your companion's last Stress or your last Hit Point and you are within close range, you or your companion can rush to the other and take that damage instead.

foundation_features.name: Ruthless Predator
foundation_features.description: When you make a damage roll, you can mark a Stress to gain +1 Proficiency. Additionally, when you deal severe damage, the target must mark a Stress.

foundation_features.name: Path Forward
foundation_features.description: When traveling to a place you've visited before or if you carry an object that has been there, you can identify the shortest, most direct path to your destination.

specialization_features.name: Elusive Predator
specialization_features.description: When your Focus attacks you, gain +2 Evasion against that attack.

mastery_features.name: Apex Predator
mastery_features.description: Before you make an attack roll against your Focus, you can spend a Hope. On a successful attack, remove a Fear from the GM's Fear pool.

foundation_features.name: Shadow Stepper
foundation_features.description: Move from shadow to shadow. When you enter darkness or a shadow cast by a creature or object, you can mark a Stress to vanish and reappear inside another shadow within far range. You are Cloaked when you reappear.

specialization_features.name: Dark Cloud
specialization_features.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, create a temporary dark cloud covering an area within close range. Those inside cannot see out, and those outside cannot see in. You are Cloaked from adversaries for whom the cloud blocks line of sight.

specialization_features.name: Adrenaline
specialization_features.description: While you are Vulnerable, add your level to your damage rolls.

mastery_features.name: Fleeting Shadow
mastery_features.description: Gain a permanent +1 bonus to your Evasion. Shadow Stepper can move you within very far range.

mastery_features.name: Vanishing Act
mastery_features.description: Mark a Stress to become Cloaked at any time. You automatically clear Restrained while Cloaked from this feature. You remain Cloaked until you roll with Fear or until your next rest.

foundation_features.name: Well-Connected
foundation_features.description: When you arrive in a prominent town or environment, you know someone there. Give them a name, note how they could help, and choose one fact: they owe you a favor but are hard to find; they will ask for something in exchange; they are always in trouble; you used to be together; or you did not part on good terms.

specialization_features.name: Contacts Everywhere
specialization_features.description: Once per session, call on a shady contact. Choose one: they provide 1 handful of gold, a unique tool, or a needed mundane object; your next action roll gains +3 to the result of your Hope or Fear Die; or the next time you deal damage, they snipe from the shadows adding 2d8 to the damage roll.

mastery_features.name: Reliable Backup
mastery_features.description: You can use Contacts Everywhere three times per session. Additional options: when you mark 1 or more Hit Points, they reduce the Hit Points marked by 1; or when you make a Presence roll, they back you up and you can roll a d20 as your Hope Die.

foundation_features.name: Spirit Weapon
foundation_features.description: When you have a melee or very close weapon equipped, it can fly to attack an adversary within close range and return. You can mark a Stress to target an additional adversary within range with the same attack roll.

foundation_features.name: Sparing Touch
foundation_features.description: Once per long rest, touch a creature to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress.

specialization_features.name: Devout
specialization_features.description: When you roll your Prayer Dice, roll one additional die and discard the lowest. You can use Sparing Touch twice per long rest.

mastery_features.name: Sacred Resonance
mastery_features.description: When you roll damage for Spirit Weapon, if any dice match, double each matching die's value.

foundation_features.name: Wings of Light
foundation_features.description: You can fly. While flying, you can mark a Stress to carry a willing creature about your size or smaller, or spend a Hope to deal an extra 1d8 damage on a successful attack.

specialization_features.name: Ethereal Visage
specialization_features.description: While flying, you have advantage on Presence rolls. When you succeed with Hope on a Presence roll, you can remove a Fear from the GM's Fear pool instead of gaining Hope.

mastery_features.name: Ascendant
mastery_features.description: Gain a permanent +4 bonus to your severe damage threshold.

mastery_features.name: Power of the Gods
mastery_features.description: While flying, the extra damage from Wings of Light becomes 1d12 instead of 1d8.

foundation_features.name: Elementalist
foundation_features.description: Choose air, earth, fire, lightning, or water at character creation. You can shape it into harmless effects. Spend a Hope and describe how it helps an action roll to gain either +2 to the roll or +3 to the roll's damage.

specialization_features.name: Natural Evasion
specialization_features.description: When an attack against you succeeds, you can mark a Stress and describe how your element defends you. Roll a d6 and add it to your Evasion against the attack.

mastery_features.name: Transcendence
mastery_features.description: Once per long rest, transform into a physical manifestation of your element. Choose two benefits until your next rest: +4 severe threshold, +1 to a trait, +1 Proficiency, or +2 Evasion.

foundation_features.name: Manipulate Magic
foundation_features.description: After you cast a spell or make a magic-damage weapon attack, you can mark a Stress to do one: extend the reach by one range; gain +2 to the action roll result; double a damage die of your choice; or hit an additional target within range.

specialization_features.name: Enchanted Aid
specialization_features.description: When you Help an Ally with a Spellcast Roll, roll a d8 as your advantage die. Once per long rest, after an ally makes a Spellcast Roll with your help, you can swap the results of their Duality Dice.

mastery_features.name: Arcane Charge
mastery_features.description: When you take magic damage, you become Charged; or spend 2 Hope to become Charged. When you hit with magic damage while Charged, clear the Charge to gain +10 damage or +3 to the Difficulty of a reaction roll the spell causes. You stop being Charged at your next long rest.

foundation_features.name: Courage
foundation_features.description: When you fail a roll with Fear, you gain a Hope.

foundation_features.name: Battle Ritual
foundation_features.description: Once per long rest, before attempting something incredibly dangerous or facing a foe who outmatches you, describe your ritual or preparations. Clear 2 Stress and gain 2 Hope.

specialization_features.name: Rise to the Challenge
specialization_features.description: While you have 2 or fewer Hit Points unmarked, you can roll a d20 as your Hope Die.

mastery_features.name: Camaraderie
mastery_features.description: You can initiate a Tag Team Roll one additional time per session. When an ally initiates a Tag Team Roll with you, they only need to spend 2 Hope.

foundation_features.name: Slayer
foundation_features.description: You gain a pool of Slayer Dice. On a roll with Hope, you can place a d6 in the pool instead of gaining Hope. You can store a number equal to your Proficiency. When you make an attack or damage roll, you can spend any number, rolling them and adding the total. At session end, clear unspent Slayer Dice and gain a Hope per die cleared.

specialization_features.name: Weapon Specialist
specialization_features.description: When you succeed on an attack, you can spend a Hope to add one damage die from your secondary weapon to the damage roll. Once per long rest, when you roll Slayer Dice, reroll any 1s.

mastery_features.name: Martial Preparation
mastery_features.description: Your party gains the Martial Preparation downtime move. During a rest, describe training; you and each ally who chooses the move gain a d6 Slayer Die. A PC can spend their Slayer Die to add it to an attack or damage roll.

foundation_features.name: Prepared
foundation_features.description: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

foundation_features.name: Adept
foundation_features.description: When you Utilize an Experience, you can mark a Stress instead of spending a Hope. If you do, double your Experience modifier for that roll.

specialization_features.name: Accomplished
specialization_features.description: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

specialization_features.name: Perfect Recall
specialization_features.description: Once per rest, when you recall a domain card in your vault, reduce its Recall Cost by 1.

mastery_features.name: Brilliant
mastery_features.description: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower from a domain you have access to.

mastery_features.name: Honed Expertise
mastery_features.description: When you use an Experience, roll a d6. On a 5 or higher, you can use it without spending Hope.

foundation_features.name: Battlemage
foundation_features.description: Gain an additional Hit Point slot.

foundation_features.name: Face Your Fear
foundation_features.description: When you succeed with Fear on an attack roll, you deal an extra 1d10 magic damage.

specialization_features.name: Conjure Shield
specialization_features.description: While you have at least 2 Hope, add your Proficiency to your Evasion.

specialization_features.name: Fueled by Fear
specialization_features.description: The extra magic damage from Face Your Fear increases to 2d10.

mastery_features.name: Thrive in Chaos
mastery_features.description: When you succeed on an attack, you can mark a Stress after rolling damage to force the target to mark an additional Hit Point.

mastery_features.name: Have No Fear
mastery_features.description: The extra magic damage from Face Your Fear increases to 3d10.
